clinical_study.brief_title: Use of Inhaled Nitric Oxide to Prevent Pulmonary Hypertension Associated to Stored Blood Transfusion
clinical_study.official_title: Pulmonary Hemodynamic Effects of Stored Red Blood Cell Transfusion in Post-Operative Cardiac Surgical Patients: Influence of Breathing Nitric Oxide. A Randomized Controlled Trial in the Cardiac-Intensive Care Unit.

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to assess if prolonged storage time of a packed red blood cell unit may cause pulmonary vasoconstriction after transfusion, in a susceptible population such as cardiac surgery patients. The investigators will also evaluate the potential reversal effect of Inhaled Nitric Oxide on pulmonary vasoconstriction induced by stored blood transfusions.

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients will be randomized into one of the three groups:
I. Blood transfusion stored for less than 10 days II. Blood transfusion stored for more than 30 days III. Blood transfusion stored for more than 30 days days plus inhalation of Nitric Oxide at 80 part per million for an hour during blood transfusion.

clinical_study.why_stopped: This trial never started due to lack of funding.

primary_outcome.time_frame: During and after blood transfusion- average time of observation 6 hours
primary_outcome.description: Parameters to calculate pulmonary vascular resistance index will be measured during and after blood transfusion for about 6 hours. The following parameters will be recorded: height, weight, systemic pressure, pulmonary pressure, wedge pressure, central venous pressure, cardiac output) of each subjects will be recorded.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During and after blood transfusion- average time of observation 6 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Hemolytic markers will be measured such as: haptoglobin, plasma free hemoglobin, hemopexin, and iron metabolites.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Provide written informed consent
2. Elective cardiac or aortic surgery
3. One or more blood transfusions scheduled for clinical reasons
4. Presence of an arterial catheter and pulmonary arterial catheter
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Emergent cardiac surgery.
2. Patients requiring irradiated or washed blood transfusions.
